summary: This bill, the Strengthening Protections for Domestic Violence and Stalking Survivors Act of 2025, amends Title 18 of the United States Code to expand the definition of "intimate partner" to include dating partners (current and former) and their children concerning domestic violence and misdemeanor crimes of stalking. It also creates a new prohibition on firearms for those convicted of misdemeanor crimes of stalking. The bill aims to protect survivors by broadening the scope of protections and disarming individuals convicted of stalking offenses.
